alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued April 04 at 6:20AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...THE FOREST SERVICE UTAH AVALANCHE CENTER IN SALT LAKE CITY HAS ISSUED A BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING WHICH IS IN EFFECT FROM 6AM MDT TUESDAY MORNING TO 6AM WEDNESDAY. * WHAT...The avalanche danger for the warning area will be HIGH today. * WHERE...For the mountains of Northern Utah and Southeast Idaho including the Wasatch Range, Bear River Range, and Uinta Mountains. * WHEN...In effect from 6AM MDT this morning to 6AM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Recent heavy accumulations of snow and drifting have created widespread areas of unstable snow. Long running natural and human triggered avalanches are likely. People should avoid being in backcountry avalanche terrain and stay clear of avalanche runouts. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Stay off of and out from under slopes steeper than 30 degrees. Backcountry travelers should consult www.utahavalanchecenter.org or call 1-888-999-4019 for more detailed information. This Warning does not apply to ski areas where avalanche hazard reduction measures are performed.

area.areaDesc: Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains
